pageContext.claim: “[Trump is reminded he is asking the Supreme Court to end protections for patients with preexisting conditions.] No. So that we can do new healthcare.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a false premise, as Trump did not need the Supreme Court to rule on the Affordable Care Act before proposing a replacement plan or starting the legislative process. Despite nearly four years in office, Trump has never settled on what this "new healthcare" would look like, despite repeatedly promising it. He had backed GOP bills that would have weakened protections for preexisting conditions.
